@thechicoazul @r4chaelc1878 Saw him in the round at the NEC Lovesexy tour in 1988. One of my favourite artists, also slightly different - to get to the stage (centre of the venue) he was put in a flight case and pushed to the stage from the dressing room. Sign of the Times album and video are classics.

@Holdentheblue @Byrdsman75 @Paddy_Boyland I clean broke my tibia and fibula (quite a few years ago now, having managed to collide with a milk float whilst cycling), plate screwed into tibia, which was later removed once the leg had healed.

@Holdentheblue @Byrdsman75 @Paddy_Boyland Its the second bone in the lower leg, behind the shin bone (tibia), not as bad as the tibia, or both, breaking. Tibia will act as support whilst the fibula is mending so hopefully will be the 3-4 youve suggested.

@thechicoazul Normally find a way for an accident to happen to facilitate the upgrade, but these are such a classic but basic design, all the parts are serviceable. Damn you Gaggia!
@thechicoazul Ha! No, but when I used to partake, Cohiba Siglo VI were my preferred choice!
@thechicoazul Never experienced it, but the reviews Ive read suggest it is better, and the doubt that those reviews have now introduced means I must have it

@thechicoazul Ha! Phillips bought Gaggia and dumbed the Classic down post 2015, however they saw the error of their ways and the revised post 2019 version is now the benchmark, although my better half probably wont understand that justification to pgrade! https://t.co/5UCwXVImno
@thechicoazul Gaggia Classic (pre 2015), along with an Iberital MC2 bean grinder. Heaven

@jvblueboy @ALANMYERSMEDIA @PaulClews2 @bt_uk @ALANMYERSMEDIA try using https://t.co/BmIMAKVWsY this should tell you whats available to your property. Another useful checker is https://t.co/5s4G8SJpN8 which shows what speeds you should get. The last open is provided by OpenReach, despite the BT retail branding.
@theesk @win_n10 @rmcfadzean @jsrailton Perfect!

@ALANMYERSMEDIA @PaulClews2 @bt_uk I dont think they can do that - OpenReach invest the money to connect the property to their network, they then have to offer access to all the suppliers as above not just BT retail; it may be that other suppliers have not yet got their act together.

@ALANMYERSMEDIA @PaulClews2 @bt_uk This intrigues me - what makes you think that? OpenReach provide the network that is available to multiple suppliers to use including not just BT retail but others such as Zen (see https://t.co/Vr3y4cirzK for the full list

@ALANMYERSMEDIA @PaulClews2 @bt_uk Have avoided BT retail for the last 20 years. Now with Zen - cant fault them, UK based, excellent customer service. You'd still have to deal with OpenReach with the install, which may still be an issue from what I can see?

@OfficialOMD Grew up in Portsmouth, cutting my teeth on AM, became a big fan, and went on to look at your back catalogue - and staggered that someone would write about an oil refinery. Came to the Liverpool in 86 to study, have lived on the Wirral for 26 years and now fully appreciate why!
